sentence.text: We identified a new susceptibility locus for bladder cancer at 5q12.3, located in the intron of protein peptidyl-prolyl isomerization (rs2042329), that was significantly associated with disease risk (OR = 1.40; P = 4.61 Ã— 10(-11)).
The rs2042329 risk allele was also related to significantly increased expression levels of protein peptidyl-prolyl isomerization mRNA and protein in bladder cancer tissues from Chinese patients.
Additional functional analyses suggested that protein peptidyl-prolyl isomerization played an oncogenic role in bladder cancer by inducing cell proliferation and suppressing apoptosis.
